{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/title|digits}}
{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl rev multi|until1=c++11
|dcl1=
static const int digits;
|dcl2=
static constexpr int digits;
}}
{{dcl end}}

The value of {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::digits}} is the number of digits in base-{{rlp|radix}} that can be represented by the type {{tt|T}} without change. For integer types, this is the number of bits not counting the sign bit and the padding bits (if any). For floating-point types, this is the digits of the mantissa (for {{rlp|is_iec559|IEC 559/IEEE 754}} implementations, this is the number of digits stored for the mantissa plus one, because the mantissa has an implicit leading 1 and binary point).
